alert.note: Alert for Camden; Currituck; Pasquotank (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 10 at 5:42PM EDT until August 10 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Camden County in northeastern North Carolina... Southeastern Pasquotank County in northeastern North Carolina... Southeastern Currituck County in northeastern North Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 542 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Old Trap, or near Grandy, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Grandy, Old Trap, Corolla, Poplar Branch, Spot, Aydlett, Glen Cove, Jarvisburg, Powells Point, Texas, Bertha, Goose Creek, and Mamie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
